abstract: Citigroup may sell Citibank Privatkunden, its consumer-banking unit in Germany, as part of a plan to replenish capital, the unit, based in Düsseldorf, said.
snippet: Citigroup may sell Citibank Privatkunden, its consumer-banking unit in Germany, as part of a plan to replenish capital, the unit, based in Düsseldorf, said.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup may sell Citibank Privatkunden, its consumer-banking unit in Germany, as part of a plan to replenish capital, the unit, based in Düsseldorf, said. The German retail unit could fetch 5 billion euros ($7.8 billion) to 6 billion euros, according to Dirk Becker, an analyst at Landsbanki Kepler in Frankfurt. Citigroup’s chief executive, Vikram S. Pandit, has said he plans to get rid of about $400 billion in assets over the next three years. Citigroup’s German unit has about 6,800 employees and 3.2 million customers and is one of the country’s largest credit card issuers.

headline.main: Citigroup May Sell Its German Banking Business
headline.print_headline: Citigroup May Sell Its German Banking Business
